summary.title: EverMart Online
summary.description:
Data Assets
● Database of inventory
● Database of customer information (cloud hosted)
● Database of transactions (cloud hosted)
Services
● External website for users to shop (requires authentication)
● Internal website for sellers to update the shop (requires authentication)
Users
● Sellers
● Buyers
● EverMart employees

data.name: Authentication
data.description: Handles user authentication by validating login credentials (username and password) for buyers, sellers, and employees

threats.title: Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could try to impersonate a legitimate user to gain unauthorized access
threats.mitigation: Use multi-factor authentication (MFA) to prevent spoofing

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: Someone might attempt to alter login requests in transit (e.g., man-in-the-middle attack)
threats.mitigation: Encrypt communications using TLS (Transport Layer Security)

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege
threats.description: A regular user might attempt to gain admin privileges by exploiting a vulnerability
threats.mitigation: Implement role-based access control (RBAC) and regularly audit permissions

data.name: Inventory Management
data.description: The Inventory Management Process allows sellers and EverMart employees to update product details such as stock levels, pricing, descriptions, and product availability. This process ensures that the inventory database remains accurate and up-to-date for customer purchases

data.name: Transaction
data.description: The Transaction Process handles the flow of customer purchases, including the validation of payment details, processing card payments, updating order statuses, and confirming the exchange of goods or services. This process interacts with the Transaction Database and payment gateways to complete purchases

threats.title: Repudiation
threats.description: A buyer might deny having made a purchase
threats.mitigation: Use digital signatures or log transaction details securely to maintain non-repudiation

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: An attacker could try to alter the transaction details (e.g., changing the amount or recipient)
threats.mitigation: Implement transaction validation checks before processing

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: A malicious third party might intercept transaction data
threats.mitigation: Secure transactions using encryption during transmission (TLS)

data.name: Inventory Database
data.description: The Inventory Database stores data related to the products available for sale on EverMart, including product IDs, names, descriptions, quantities, prices, and stock levels. This database is accessed by sellers to update product details and by the system to check availability when processing customer orders.

data.name: Customer Database
data.description: The Customer Database stores sensitive customer information, including names, addresses, email addresses, hashed passwords, and payment information. It is hosted on a cloud service and accessed by various processes for authentication and transaction handling

threats.title: Information Disclosure
threats.description: Unauthorized parties could access sensitive customer data (e.g., passwords, payment information)
threats.mitigation: Encrypt sensitive fields like passwords (using hashing) and payment details

threats.title: Tampering
threats.description: A malicious insider could modify customer data
threats.mitigation: Implement strict access controls, and log all access to the database

threats.title: Denial of Service
threats.description: An attacker could flood the database with requests, causing it to crash or become unavailable
threats.mitigation: Implement rate-limiting, and have database failover mechanisms in place

data.name: Transaction Database
data.description: The Transaction Database stores detailed records of customer purchases, including items bought, transaction amounts, payment information, timestamps, and order status. It is hosted on a cloud platform and accessed by processes that manage order processing, payment verification, and customer notifications.
